VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 4 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The facility had three corrective action plans related to special investigations and
one corrective action plan related to the 2022 renewal audit. The special
investigation corrective action plans were regarding violations for staff sufficiency,
staff supervision, and resident restraints. The facility resolved these issues by
having further training regarding restraints, increasing the number of staff in the
facility and increasing communication amongst employees. The most significant
impact to improving these areas was an increase in hiring beginning in June 2022.
The facility is now fully staffed. The 2022 renewal audit had a citation regarding
staff evaluations, which was not found as an issue during the period of review for
this 2023 interim audit.
Financial Overview
The facility's financial information was reviewed and there were no concerns.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator (CA) reported the facility was able to improve the area of
completing timely staff evaluations through increased diligence by the Project
Coordinator tracking these reviews and the Manager of Program Operations
working closely with supervisors to ensure compliance. CA noted hiring employees
significantly improved in June 2022 and DART is now at a fully staffing schedule.
As a result, the facility has been able to increase their census back to pre-COVID
levels. One continuing area of concern for the facility is access to comprehensive
dental treatment for residents who require sedation as it has been an ongoing
barrier. Although all youth are currently up to date with their dental appointments,
there have been historical late appointments for youth who require sedation to
achieve dental cleanings at 6 and 12-month timeframes. CA reported one CAP
activity demonstrated a positive impact for DART's program compliance, which was
the Project Coordinator and Human Resources working collaboratively regarding
review of onboarding documentation and updating practices based on updated
licensing rules and contract requirements. Additionally, the Manager of Program
Operations has worked diligently with the Assistant Program Managers to improve
documentation, staff coaching, and compliance with policies and procedures by
staff. CA noted the Project Coordinator has improved monitoring and tracking of
documentation efforts by collaborating with multiple departments within the
3

program and will continue to focus efforts on making the program more efficient
through process and procedures changes, maintaining organization of
communication tools, agendas, and CAP compliance monitoring. During the period
of review, DART identified there were two unplanned discharges for youth in the
CA report. However, after review of the situations, the facility provided advanced
notice and a discharge plan was followed for each youth prior to discharge.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were all very positive. Staff feel supervisors and upper
management always take into consideration what staff say and always have an
open-door policy. Staff felt the facility has a great working environment and feel
very supported by each other, supervisors, and upper management. Staff feel even
if there are conflicts amongst staff or surrounding situations, everyone can work
those out and communicate openly. Staff feel the communication surrounding
changes, safety plans, admissions of new youth, etc. are communicated very well
and they always feel they know what's going on. Staff feel they have enough
training to be able to complete their job duties and feel the extra shadow shifts new
staff complete are great to get them prepared for the job. The only suggestion staff
made was to make sure all necessary staff are included in the group chat as
sometimes people are missing and they'll miss some of the news and updates
others are providing, which impacts communication.
The youth interviewed did not have any concerns with the facility. They reported the
staff treat them well, they feel safe, they like the food, and they have enough food.
They reported they did not have any complaints or things they would like to change.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough of the facility was completed on 4/6/23 and there were no concerns
noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
